name: B. Chtholly s request
statement:
Chtholly has been thinking about a problem for days:If a number is and
length of its decimal representation without leading zeros is even, we
call it a zcy number. A number is means when written in decimal
representation, it contains no leading zeros and reads the same forwards
and backwards. For example and are palindromes and and are not.
Moreover, is zcy number and is not.Given integers and , calculate the
sum of the smallest zcy numbers and output this sum modulo
.Unfortunately, Willem isnâ€™t good at solving this kind of problems, so
he asks you for help!
editorial:
The -th smallest zcy number is , where denotes the decimal
representation of a positive integer as a string, denotes the
concatenation two strings, and denotes the reverse of a string. Then go
over the smallest such numbers and sum them up to obtain the answer.
